Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
simulation.Simulator
Direct Known Subclasses:
InvestmentSimulator, MarketSimulator
public abstract class Simulator extends Object
The Simulator class is an abstract base class for running stock market simulations.

It provides the core functionality for simulating stock market behavior, including managing stock holdings, calculating profits and losses, and handling stock transactions such as buying and selling shares.

This class is intended to be extended by more specific types of simulations, such as a MarketSimulator for market-wide simulations or an InvestmentSimulator for personal investment simulations.

The Simulator class also tracks the user's balance, representing the amount of money available for making stock transactions within the simulation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulator

      public Simulator()
      Creates a new Simulator instance with the specified starting balance.
      Parameters:
      startingBalance - the initial amount of money available for trading

  • Method Details

    • buyStock

      public boolean buyStock(String ticker, double pricePerShare, int quantity)
      Buys a specified number of shares of a stock if there is enough balance.
      Parameters:
      ticker - the stock ticker symbol
      pricePerShare - the price of one share
      quantity - the number of shares to buy
      Returns:
      true if purchase succeeded, false otherwise (e.g. insufficient funds)

    • sellStock

      public boolean sellStock(String ticker, double pricePerShare, int quantity)
      Sells a specified number of shares of a stock if the user holds enough shares.
      Parameters:
      ticker - the stock ticker symbol
      pricePerShare - the price of one share
      quantity - the number of shares to sell
      Returns:
      true if sale succeeded, false otherwise (e.g. insufficient shares)

    • getPortfolioValue

      public double getPortfolioValue(Map<String,Double> currentPrices)
      Returns the current total value of all holdings given a map of current prices.
      Parameters:
      currentPrices - map of ticker symbols to current price per share
      Returns:
      total market value of all held shares

    • getProfitLoss

      public double getProfitLoss(Map<String,Double> currentPrices)
      Returns the total profit or loss, defined as current balance plus portfolio value minus the starting balance.
      Parameters:
      currentPrices - map of ticker symbols to current price per share
      Returns:
      profit or loss amount (positive for profit, negative for loss)

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the simulation to its initial state.
